name: playable
content:
playable adjective
(VIDEO GAME)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a video game is playable, it is easy and enjoyable to play: I've been looking for a decent, playable space empire game for ages. These games are mostly playable but are said to still have some speed and compatibility issues.

playable adjective
(MUSIC)
If a piece of music or an instrument is playable, it is not too difficult for someone to play: The New York is a very playable guitar. "Her piano music is very playable," he said.

playable adjective
(SPORTS SURFACE)
If a surface on which sports are played is playable, it is easy or possible to play on: The tennis courts were a little worn but very playable. He said the pitch was perfectly playable, but the stadium management wanted to avoid further deterioration.

playable adjective
(BALL)
If a ball is playable, it can be caught, passed, hit, etc. within the rules of the game, or because it has not gone outside the field of play: The ball is playable if it is touching any part of a line. In cricket, bowlers deliver six playable balls to batsmen in succession to account for one "over". As long as the ball doesn't hit the floor, it's playable.

playable adjective
(FILM)
UK If a film is playable, audiences have a good reaction to it when they see it: The American version of the popular film sadly failed to be playable due to poor casting.
